data.prayer: Jesus, help the church in the county of Habiganj to not rely on buildings or programs, but on your Spirit and the simple faithfulness of every believer.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Habiganj, Sylhet, Bangladesh

data.prayer: Spirit, give the believers of the the county of Habiganj unity and humility as they work to bring the kingdom to new people and places.
Father, help the 2,617 believers in Habiganj to know your commands and to do them.
data.verse: For Ezra had devoted himself to the study and observance of the Law of the Lord, and to teaching its decrees and laws in Israel.

data.prayer: Spirit, build the strength and maturity of the local leaders in Habiganj, Sylhet, Bangladesh. Show them that faithfulness is more important than knowledge. Show them that the Spirit, the Word, and prayer is enough in order to grow and lead.
Lord, remember the Kunbi (Hindu traditions) people. Make the Kunbi (Hindu traditions) people a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for your own possession.
Lord, let it be said of the 2,086,383 lost in Habiganj that you have called them out of darkness into your glorious light.
data.verse: But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for God’s own possession, that you may proclaim the excellence of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light

data.prayer: Lord, to the people of Habiganj you say, "If you wait for Me, I will work on your behalf."
data.verse: For from of old men have not heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither has the eye seen a God besides you, who works for him who waits for him.

data.prayer: Spirit, how will they hear without a preacher? How will they preach unless they have a Bible? Please give the people in the county of Habiganj access to a Bible in their own language.
data.verse: How, then, can they call on the one they have not believed in? And how can they believe in the one of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them? And how can anyone preach unless they are sent? As it is written: “How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news!”

location.name: Habiganj
location.people_groups_list: Jaraj (Muslim traditions), Mahanta, Majhwar, Magar, Kumhar (Hindu traditions)
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Jaraj (Muslim traditions) (19,000), Mahanta (1,000), Majhwar (15,000), Magar (1,600), Kumhar (Hindu traditions) (264,000)
